title: Spring Semester Kickoff
description: Join us for our first meeting of the spring semester! We'll be discussing upcoming projects, field trips, and how you can get involved in soil and water conservation efforts on campus.

title: Erosion Control Workshop
description: A hands-on workshop demonstrating various erosion control techniques. Participants will learn how to install silt fences, use erosion control blankets, and understand the importance of vegetative cover.

title: Local Watershed Cleanup
description: Giving back to our community by cleaning up the Squaw Creek watershed. We'll be collecting debris and documenting water quality parameters as we go. Lunch provided!

title: Conservation Careers Panel
description: Meet professionals working in the field of conservation. Our panelists include soil scientists, hydrologists, and environmental policy experts. Great for networking!

title: Sustainable Farming Tour
description: Earth Day field trip to a local sustainable farm. See regenerative agriculture in action, including no-till practices and diverse cover cropping strategies.

title: End of Year BBQ
description: Celebrating a successful year of conservation work! Relax, enjoy some good food, and help us plan for next year's adventures.
